text: Enrico Caruso (February 25, 1873 â€“ August 2, 1921) was an Italian operic tenor. He was born and died in Naples. He sang at La Scala and the Metropolitan Opera House. In 1987, he received a Grammy Lifetime Achievement Award. ==References== Category:1873 births Category:1921 deaths Category:Entertainers from Campania Category:Italian opera singers Category:Singers from Naples Category:19th-century singers Category:20th- century singers
